default: {@i (a)} A {@filter martial weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon} and a {@item shield|phb} or {@i (b)} two {@filter martial weapons|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon} or {@i (c)} a {@item longbow|phb} and {@item arrows (20)|phb|20 arrows}
{@i (a)} a {@item scholar's pack|phb} or {@i (b)} an {@item explorer's pack|phb}
{@i (a)} a {@item component pouch|phb} or {@i (b)} an {@item arcane focus|phb}

classFeature.name: Arcane Armaments
entries: {@i 1st-level weaveknight feature}

Your style of fighting allows you to imbue items in your arsenal with arcane power. You can initiate a 10 minute ritual with a weapon, suit of armor or shield that you are proficient with, which can be done during a short rest. After the ritual is completed, you mark the weapon, suit of armor or shield with a personalized special rune, turning it into an Arcane Armament.

As a bonus action, you can either shunt any number of your Arcane Armaments into an extradimensional space, or summon any number of your Arcane Armaments, instantly equipping them (weapon) or donning them (suit of armor or shield), provided that they are in the same plane of existence as you and you have a free hand (weapon or shield) or aren't wearing any armor (suit of armor).

The maximum number of Arcane Armaments you can have at a time is equal to 2, and it increases when you reach certain levels in this class: at 5th level (3), at 9th level (4), at 13th level (5) and at 17th level (6). If you attempt to turn a weapon, suit of armor or shield into an Arcane Armament while you're at your maximum, you must select one of your Arcane Armaments to lose the benefits of this feature. Arcane Armaments appear at your feet if they are in the extradimensional space when they lose the benefits of this feature.

classFeature.name: Arcane Warcraft
entries: {@i 1st-level weaveknight feature}

You learn two Stances of your choice from the {@filter list of Stances|optionalfeatures|feature type=stance} detailed at the end of the class description. When you gain certain weaveknight levels, you learn additional Stances of your choice as shown in the Stances Known column of the Weaveknight table.

Stances are unique combat forms that grant you certain benefits while you're maintaining them. You can enter a stance that you know as a bonus action, gaining its benefits for 1 minute. You can only maintain one stance at a time. You can end a stance at any time (no action required), and you don't gain a stance's benefits while {@condition incapacitated}.

Each stance is also associated with an Arcane Strike spell (all Arcane Strike spells have the {@i arcane strike} tag, and are not spells on the weaveknight spell list). While you know a Stance, you also know its associated Arcane Strike spell, which counts as a weaveknight spell for you but doesn't count against the number of weaveknight spells you know. You can only cast an Arcane Strike spell while you are maintaining the stance it is associated with.
Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the Stances you know and replace it with another Stance that you could learn at that level.

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: {@i 1st-level weaveknight feature}
You have learned to harness arcane magic to complement your martial skills.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Weaveknight table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your weaveknight spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these weaveknight spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.
For example, if you know the 1st-level spell {@spell burning hands} and have a 1st-level and a 2nd-level spell slot available, you can cast {@spell burning hands} using either slot.

entries.name: Spell Known of 1st-Level and Higher
entries: You know two 1st-level weaveknight spells of your choice from the weaveknight spell list.

The Spells Known column of the Weaveknight table shows when you learn more weaveknight spells of your choice. Each of these spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For instance, when you reach 5th level in this class, you can learn one new spell of 1st or 2nd level.

Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the weaveknight spells you know and replace it with another spell from the weaveknight spell list, which also must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for your weaveknight spells, since you learn your spells through study and memorization. You use your Intelligence whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Intelligence modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a weaveknight spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use an {@item arcane focus|PHB} or an {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1||Arcane Armament} weapon or shield as your spellcasting focus for your weaveknight spells, and you can perform the somatic components of weaveknight spells while holding an {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1||Arcane Armament} in one or both hands.

entries.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: From various sources or for various reasons, you might find spells that fit the Weaveknight's theme but are not present in the current spell list. Should you include them in your game, or include the Weaveknight in a game that uses these spells, consider the following guidelines as to which spells should expand the Weaveknight spell list, always at the GM's discretion:

items: Consider {@filter wizard spells of 1st through 5th level|spells|class=wizard|level=1;2;3;4;5} as additions to the expanded spell list, before incorporating spells from another class's spell list.

Consider spells that are eligible for the {@classFeature Spellstrike|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|2} feature, but were not designed to be incredibly powerful because they were never meant to be given to a class with such a feature ({@spell inflict wounds}, cough).

Weaveknights are all about burst damage with their {@classFeature Spellstrike|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|2}, self-buffing, debuffing and utility. As a result, the most fitting spells to expand their spell list are of the abjuration, conjuration, enchantment, evocation or transmutation schools.

Weaveknights do have some of the iconic damaging wizard spells, but they are quite capable of producing damage even without them. Should you expand the spell list, consider prioritizing spells that offer more choices for maneuvering, utility and control, than pure damage.
Avoid healing spells, or spells exclusive to {@class paladin||paladins} and {@class cleric||clerics}, as to not mix the themes of these classes and the Weaveknight.

classFeature.name: Spellstrike
entries: {@i 2nd-level weaveknight feature}

You can use your action to cast a weaveknight spell of 1st-level or higher in a special way, channeling it through an {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1||Arcane Armament} melee weapon you're wielding, instead of having it take effect immediately. To be eligible, the spell must have a casting time of 1 action and either require a single spell attack roll or force a target affected by it to make a saving throw to resist its effects.

As part of casting a spell with this feature, you make a single attack using the {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1||Arcane Armament} weapon that you're channeling the spell through. On a miss, the spell fails and has no effect. On a hit, the spell takes effect against the attack's target as detailed below:

items: If the spell would normally require an attack roll against the target to affect it, it takes effect as if you had succeeded on the attack roll, and you add any damage dealt by the spell on a hit to the attack's damage. Any addifiontal effects of the spell except dealing damage on a hit take place immediately after the target takes the attack's damage.
If the spell would normally force a target to make a saving throw to resist its effects, it takes effect immediately after the target takes the attack's damage.
If the spell targets or affects an area, it takes effect immediately after the target takes the attack's damage, and you must choose the affected area in a way so that it includes the target's space.

entries: When you cast a spell with this feature, you can only cast it at a level up to the highest level weaveknight spell you know.

classFeature.name: Secret Arts
entries: {@i 2nd-level weaveknight feature}

Dedicating yourself to the study of martial combat and arcane lore, you have unearthed knowledge about special techniques usable only by ones who have trained rigorously as weaveknights. You learn two {@filter Secret Arts|optionalfeatures|type=secret art} of your choice. Your Secret Art options are detailed at the end of the class description. When you gain certain weaveknight levels, you gain additional secret arts of your choice, as shown in the Arts Known column of the Weaveknight Table.
Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the Secret Arts you know and replace it with another Secret Art that you could learn at that level.

entries.name: Saving Throws
entries: Some Secret Arts require your target to make a saving throw to resist the Secret Art's effects. The saving throw DC is equal to your weaveknight spell save DC.

classFeature.name: Weaveknight Discipline
entries: {@i 3rd-level weaveknight feature}

You choose a discipline that you strive to perfect. Choose between the Magus, the Spellwarden, the Spellbow, the Magehunter, the Initiate of Arcana Mystara, the Armsmeister or the Godsbane, all described at the end of the class description. The archetype you choose grants you features at 3rd level and again at 7th, 11th, 15th and 20th level.

entries.name: Discipline Spells
entries: Each discipline has a list of spells—its discipline spells—that you learn at the weaveknight levels noted in the discipline's description. Spells you learn from a discipline count as weaveknight spells for you, but they don't count against the number of weaveknight spells you know.

classFeature.name: Arcane Surge
entries: {@i 3rd-level weaveknight feature}

Once per turn, you can channel arcane energy to fuel different magical effects. You start knowing three such effects; Sense Magic and two other effects that are determined by your Weaveknight Discipline.

When you use your Arcane Surge, you choose which effect to produce. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest. When you reach 14th level in this class, you can use it twice before a rest.

While you have no uses of this feature available, you can expend a spell slot to use this feature again, but can still only use of this feature once per turn. If you expend a spell slot of 2nd-level or higher to use this feature again, you also regain one expended spell slot of a level lower than the level of the spell slot you expended to use this feature.

classFeature.name: Arcane Surge: Sense Magic
entries: As an action, you can use your Arcane Surge to open your awareness to magical forces. For the next 10 minutes or until you become {@condition incapacitated}, you know the location of any creature that is able to cast at least one spell within 30 feet of you that is not behind total cover. You also learn each of those creatures' spellcasting abilities, provided they have one. Within the same radius, you also detect the presence of any place or object that has been infused with or that consists of magic, such as a magic item or a ley line.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: {@i 4th-level weaveknight feature}

When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: {@i 5th-level weaveknight feature}

You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn. Moreover, you can use your {@classFeature Spellstrike|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|2} feature in place of one of those attacks.

classFeature.name: Spellblade's Lore
entries: {@i 5th-level weaveknight feature}

You are well versed in the lore of magical armaments. If you spend at least 1 hour studying lore about a specific magic weapon, magic suit of armor or magic shield that you're proficient with, you can replace the total for any Intelligence check you make regarding the lore of that specific item with your weaveknight level + your Intelligence modifier.
Once you use this feature with an Intelligence check regarding a specific item, you can't use it again with an Intelligence check regarding the same item.

classFeature.name: Arcane Power
entries: {@i 6th-level weaveknight feature}

Constantly utilizing magic to augment your martial abilities has expanded your capacity for spellcraft. You gain one additional 1st-level spell slot. Spells slots you gain from this feature are not included in the Weaveknight table.

When you reach higher levels in this class, you gain more spell slots that you can expend this way: at 10th level (one additional 2nd-level spell slot), at 14th level (one additional 3rd-level spell slot) and at 14th level (one additional 4th-level spell slot). You regain all expended spell slots that you have from this feature when you finish a long rest.

classFeature.name: Discipline Feature
entries: At 7th level, you gain a feature from your Discipline.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: {@i 8th-level weaveknight feature}

When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Greater Magic Sense
entries: {@i 9th-level weaveknight feature}

While your {@classFeature Arcane Surge: Sense Magic|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|3|CoH-Weaveknight|Arcane Surge} is active, you can add your Intelligence modifier to any saving throw you make against a spell or magical effect that originates from a space within its radius.

classFeature.name: Student of Magic and War
entries: {@i 10th-level weaveknight feature}

You have honed the craft of masterfully weaving spells even amidst the most dire of situations, steeling your focus. When you fail a Constitution saving throw that you make to maintain concentration on a weaveknight spell, you can choose to succeed instead.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest, unless you expend a use of your {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|3} to use it again.

classFeature.name: Arcane Power (2nd Level)
entries: You gain one additional 2nd-level spell slot for your {@classFeature Arcane Power|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|6} feature.

classFeature.name: Improved Spellstrike
entries: {@i 11th-level weaveknight feature}

When you cast a spell with your {@classFeature Spellstrike|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|2} feature by expending a spell slot, the spell slot you expend to cast it counts as one level higher than the spell slot's original level, up to 5th level.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Arcane Durability
entries: {@i 13th-level weaveknight feature}

While maintaining a stance, you gain resistance to the damage type dealt by the Arcane Strike spell associated with that stance, or resistance to force damgae if the associated spell doesn't deal any damage.

classFeature.name: Arcane Power (3rd Level)
entries: You gain one additional 3rd-level spell slot for your {@classFeature Arcane Power|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|6} feature.

classFeature.name: Arcane Surge (2/rest)
entries: You can use your {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|3} feature twice before a rest.

classFeature.name: Discipline Feature
entries: At 15th level, you gain a feature from your Discipline.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Spellstrike Mastery
entries: {@i 17th-level weaveknight feature}

You have mastered the art of weaving spells while performing your deadly martial strikes. When you cast a spell with your {@classFeature Spellstrike|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|2} feature, the spell isn't lost if you miss with the weapon attack you make to channel it, and you can have it take effect against any creature that you hit with a weapon attack using the {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1||Arcane Armament} weapon that you channeled it through as described in your {@classFeature Spellstrike|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|2} feature, instead.
If you cast another spell, or the spell hasn't taken effect against any target until the end of your next turn after casting it, then it fails and is lost.

classFeature.name: Arcane Power (4th Level)
entries: You gain one additional 4th-level spell slot for your {@classFeature Arcane Power|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|6} feature.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Discipline Feature
entries: At 20th level, you gain a feature from your Discipline.

subclassFeature.name: Magus
entries: The discipline of the Magus, perhaps the most knightly order of the weaveknights, is a path of flashing steel and arcane might. Fit for those who wish to fight in the frontlines with bravery, these weaveknights teleport around the battlefield and channel magic to devastate their enemies in fearsome shows of superiority. Never one to back down from a challenge, a Magus pursuits their goals in the most direct way: cut down anything that stands in between.

subclassFeature.name: Discipline Spells
entries: You learn discipline spells at the weaveknight levels listed in the Magus Spells table. Discipline spells count as weaveknight spells for you, but they don't count against the number of weaveknight spells you know.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Warrior
entries: When you attack with an {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1||Arcane Armament} melee weapon, you can use your Intelligence modifier, instead of Strength or Dexterity, for the attack and damage rolls.

subclassFeature.name: Surge of the Magus
entries: You gain the following two {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|3} options:

entries.name: Arcane Cleave
entries: When you deal damage to a creature with an attack using an {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1||Arcane Armament} melee weapon, you can expend one use of your {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|3} to target a second creature that you can see within 5 feet of the first creature. The target takes force damage equal to half the damage you dealt to the first creature with the attack.

entries.name: Warp Step
entries: As a bonus action, you can expend one use of your {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|3} to teleport to an unoccupied space you can see. The chosen space must be within 10 feet of you. The range you can teleport to increases when you reach certain levels in this class: at 5th level (15 feet), 9th level (20 feet) , 13th level (25 feet) and 17th level (30 feet).

subclassFeature.name: Reaving Spellstrike
entries: When you make an attack with an {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1||Arcane Armament} weapon as part of using your {@classFeature Spellstrike|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|2} feature, you can expend one use of your {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|3} to gain advantage on the attack roll.

subclassFeature.name: Rebuking Spellstrike
entries: When a creature within 5 feet of you hits you with an attack, you can use your reaction to use your {@classFeature Spellstrike|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|2} feature against the target. When you do so, the spell must target only that creature.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Flurry
entries: As a bonus action, you can enter a state of extreme focus for 1 minute, amplifying the amount of arcane energy you can channel. For the duration, you gain the following benefits:

items: You can produce up to two effects that require you to expend a use of your {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|3} per turn, provided they're different effects.

You can use your {@subclassFeature Surge of the Magus|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|Magus|CoH-Weaveknight|3||Arcane Cleave and Warp Step} features without expending any uses of your {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|3}.

Whenever you take the {@action Attack} action and expened a spell slot to cast a spell with your {@classFeature Spellstrike|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|2} feature in place of one of the attacks you make as part of that action, you can make an additional number of attacks equal to half the spell slot's level as part of that action.

entries: Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest, unless you expend a 5th-level spell slot to use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Spellwarden
entries: Spellwardens are abjuration specialists. However, these weaveknights are able to touch the very essence of abjuration magic and learn how to empower their physical and mental abilities with arcane energies. The Spellwarden discipline requires the practitioner to be brave and face the terrors of the world with conviction, as well as develop innate endurance towards magic. Spellwardens are team players, leading fights as unyielding rocks their allies can always depend on.

subclassFeature.name: Discipline Spells
entries: You learn discipline spells at the weaveknight levels listed in the Spellwarden Spells table. Discipline spells count as weaveknight spells for you, but they don't count against the number of weaveknight spells you know.

subclassFeature.name: Abjurant Defense
entries: You gain proficiency with heavy armor. While you're wearing an {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1||Arcane Armament} suit of armor, bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage that you take from nonmagical attacks is reduced by 2. This reduction increases when you reach certain levels in this class: at 5th level (3), at 9th level (4), at 13th level (5) and 17th level (6).

subclassFeature.name: Surge of the Spellwarden
entries: You gain the following two {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|3} options:

entries.name: Arcane Bulwark
entries: As a bonus action, you can expend one use of your {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|3} to grant yourself or one creature that you can see within 30 feet of you temporary hit points equal to your weaveknight level + your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1 temporary hit point). These temporary hit points last for 1 minute or until you use this feature again.

entries.name: Extended Abjuration
entries: When you cast an abjuration weaveknight spell that targets only you, you can expend one use of your {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|3} to choose a second creature within 30 feet of you. The spell also targets the chosen creature.

subclassFeature.name: Aegis
entries: When you or a creature you can see within 30 feet of you takes damage or makes a saving throw, you can use your reaction and expend one use of your {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|3} to reduce the damage taken by an amount equal to {@dice 1d8} + your weaveknight level + your Intelligence modifier (minimum 1), or grant it a bonus to the saving throw equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum 1).

subclassFeature.name: Spell Resistance
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against spells and resistance against the damage of spells.

subclassFeature.name: Mass Warding
entries: As a bonus action, you can create a powerful warding that lasts for 1 minute. For the duration, you gain the following benefits:

items: You can use your {@subclassFeature Surge of the Spellwarden|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|Spellwarden|CoH-Weaveknight|3||Arcane Bulwark and Extended Abjuration} features without expending uses of your {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|3}, but you can still produce only one effect that requires you to expend a use of your {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|3} per turn.

When you use your {@subclassFeature Surge of the Spellwarden|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|Spellwarden|CoH-Weaveknight|3||Arcane Bulwark or Extended Abjuration} feature, you can target a number of creatures up to your Intelligence modifier with that feature.

While a creature has temporary hit points from your {@subclassFeature Surge of the Spellwarden|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|Spellwarden|CoH-Weaveknight|3||Arcane Bulwark} feature, it also gains the benefits of your {@subclassFeature Spell Resistance|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|Spellwarden|CoH-Weaveknight|15} feature.

entries: Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest, unless you expend a 5th-level spell slot to use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Spellbow
entries: Incorporating ancient elven techniques that amplify their ranged spells and arrows, the Spellbows are the tacticians of the weaveknights. Observing and tactically handpicking targets, it was once said that a single company of master Spellbows felled an entire army of demons. This discipline involves patience, self reflection and quick thinking. To achieve the perfect shot, to never miss and to always flow like the weave of magic they swore to protect, the Spellbows never accept failure.

subclassFeature.name: Discipline Spells
entries: You learn discipline spells at the weaveknight levels listed in the Spellbow Spells table. Discipline spells count as weaveknight spells for you, but they don't count against the number of weaveknight spells you know.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Archer
entries: Your training allows you to fire shots based on predictions rather than natural precision. When you attack with an {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1||Arcane Armament} ranged weapon, you can use your Intelligence modifier, instead of Strength or Dexterity modifier, for the attack and damage rolls.

In addition, you can use your {@classFeature Spellstrike|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|2} feature with {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1||Arcane Armament} weapons that are ranged, instead of only melee weapons.

subclassFeature.name: Surge of the Spellbow
entries: You gain the following two {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|3} options:

entries.name: Bursting Spellshot
entries: When you deal damage to a creature with a ranged attack using an {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1||Arcane Armament} weapon, you can expend one use of your {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|3} to cause an eruption of arcane energy around the target. Each creature within 10 feet of the attack's target, except the target, must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your weaveknight spell save DC or take force damage equal to {@dice 1d10} + half your weaveknight level.

entries.name: Piercing Spellshot
entries: When you make a ranged attack with an {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1||Arcane Armament} weapon, you can expend one use of your {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|3} to augment the attack. The attack ignores half and three-quarters cover and on a hit, its target takes a penalty to its AC equal to half your proficiency bonus until the start of its next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Arcing Shot
entries: When you make a ranged attack with an {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1||Arcane Armament} weapon and miss, you can use your reaction and expend one use of your {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|3} to reroll the attack roll against a different target within 60 feet of the attack's original target.

subclassFeature.name: Piercing Shots
entries: When you make a ranged attack with an {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1||Arcane Armament} weapon as part of using your {@classFeature Spellstrike|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|2} feature and use your {@subclassFeature Surge of the Spellbow|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|Spellbow|CoH-Weaveknight|3} feature with the attack, the benefits of your {@subclassFeature Surge of the Spellbow|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|Spellbow|CoH-Weaveknight|3} feature improve, as detailed below:

entries.name: Bursting Spellshot
entries: You add twice the level of the channeled spell to the damage that the eruption of arcane energy deals to creatures on a failed save.

entries.name: Piercing Spellshot
entries: The attack's damage ignores any resistance to its damage that its target has.

subclassFeature.name: Perfect Shot
entries: As a bonus action, you can draw mana into your body to sharpen your senses to the extreme for 1 minute. For the duration, you gain the following benefits:

items: The damage of your {@subclassFeature Piercing Shots|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|Spellbow|CoH-Weaveknight|15||Bursting Spellshot} is doubled and attacks affected by your {@subclassFeature Piercing Shots|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|Spellbow|CoH-Weaveknight|15||Piercing Spellshot} also ignore total cover, as long as there is a path the attack can follow to reach the target.

Whenever you take the {@action Attack} action, you can make an additional attack as part of that action, provided it is a ranged attack you make with an {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1||Arcane Armament}.

Whenever you reduce a creature's hit points to below twice your weaveknight level + your Intelligence modifier with damage from an attack you make, a weaveknight spell you cast or your {@subclassFeature Piercing Shots|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|Spellbow|CoH-Weaveknight|15||Bursting Spellshot} feature, that creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against your weaveknight spell save DC or die.

entries: Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest, unless you expend a 5th-level spell slot to use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Magehunter
entries: Of all the weaveknights, the Magehunters understand the importance of balance most. This discipline enforces the practitioner to endure excruciating mental pain, as learning how to bend the arcane energy around other creatures, partially severing their connection to the weave of magic is a dreadful task. Many Magehunters have lost loved ones or witnessed destruction in the face of untamed magicians, and have sworn themselves their eternal enemies. If the most powerful of spellcasters can be called demi-gods, then the Magehunters are one of the few reminders of their mortality.

subclassFeature.name: Discipline Spells
entries: You learn discipline spells at the weaveknight levels listed in the Magehunter Spells table. Discipline spells count as weaveknight spells for you, but they don't count against the number of weaveknight spells you know.

subclassFeature.name: Hunter's Vigilance
entries: Your studies have taught you to always be ready to strike. You can add your Intelligence modifier to your initiative rolls.

subclassFeature.name: Surge of the Magehunter
entries: You gain the following two {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|3} options:

entries.name: Dispelling Strike
entries: When you hit a creature with an attack using an {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1||Arcane Armament} weapon, you can expend one use of your {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|3} to end one spell on the target. If the spell is of a level higher than half your proficiency bonus, you must succeed on an Intelligence check with a DC equal to 10 + the spell's level to end it. When you use this feature, you can choose to deal no damage to the attack's target.

entries.name: Magehunter's Brand
entries: As a bonus action, you can expend one use of your {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|3} feature to choose a creature that you can see within 30 feet of you. The target is marked for 1 minute. The mark fades early if the target dies, you die, you use this feature to mark another creature, or you are incapacitated. Until the mark fades, you gain the benefits of your {@classFeature Arcane Surge: Sense Magic|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|3|CoH-Weaveknight|Arcane Surge} feature against the marked creature, and the first time you hit that creature with an attack using an {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1||Arcane Armament} weapon on a turn, you can deal extra psychic damage to the target equal to your proficiency bonus. This damage is doubled if the target is concentrating on a spell. If this attack causes the marked creature to make a Constitution saving throw to maintain concentration on a spell, it must subtract your Intelligence modifier from the total rolled for its saving throw.

subclassFeature.name: Spellcarving Brand
entries: When you force a creature to make a saving throw against a weaveknight spell you cast or a weaveknight class feature, you can expend one use of your {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|3} to give the target disadvantage on the roll (no action required). If the target is currently marked with your Magehunter's Brand, you can end it on the target to use this feature instead.

subclassFeature.name: Magic Mettle
entries: Your training allows you to completely resist spells that would affect you normally. When you succeed on a saving throw against a spell or magical effect that targets only you and would still affect you on a successful save, the spell or magical effect instead has no effect on you.

subclassFeature.name: Anti-Magic Aura
entries: Your prowess over hunting mages manifests fully. As a bonus action, you emit an anti-magical aura, causing violent arcane energies to surround you in a 30-foot radius, gaining the following benefits for 1 minute:

items: You gain the benefits of your {@classFeature Arcane Surge: Sense Magic|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|3|CoH-Weaveknight|Arcane Surge} feature.

Creatures of your choice that start their turn within the aura's radius must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your weaveknight spell save DC or be unable to cast spells until the start of their next turn.

When you cast an abjuration spell that requires you to make an ability check as a part of casting that spell (such as {@spell counterspell} and {@spell dispel magic}) or an ability check with your {@subclassFeature Surge of the Magehunter|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|Magehunter|CoH-Weaveknight|3||Dispelling Strike} feature, you add your proficiency bonus to that ability check.

entries: Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest, unless you expend a 5th-level spell slot to use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Initiate of Arcana Mystara
entries: The search for knowledge and secrets is inherent to all weaveknights, but the Initiates of Arcana Mystara value only the truths of the world and thus are rewarded with extraordinary mastery over the weave. This discipline requires incredible dedication and study, as master Initiates are able to match the most powerful of wizards toe to toe in spellcasting as well as channel magic into their weapons to divine their enemies' weakness with each blow. As revered arcane acolytes, they command respect even amongst the most seasoned weaveknights, often becoming spiritual guides in dark times.

subclassFeature.name: Discipline Spells
entries: You learn discipline spells at the weaveknight levels listed in the Initiate of Arcana Mystara Spells table. Discipline spells count as weaveknight spells for you, but they don't count against the number of weaveknight spells you know.

subclassFeature.name: Arcana Esoterica
entries: Your focus on the sorcery side of sword and sorcery grants you an extra edge over other weaveknights. You become proficient in your choice of two of the following skills: {@skill Arcana}, {@skill History}, {@skill Nature}, or {@skill Religion}.

In addition, choose a class that has a spell list other than this class. Whenever you would learn a weaveknight spell with your {@classFeature Spellcasting|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1|CoH-Weaveknight} feature, you can also choose that spell from the spell list of the class you chose with this feature, instead of only the weaveknight spell list, and it counts as a weaveknight spell for you.

subclassFeature.name: Surge of the Arcana Mystara Initiate
entries: You gain the following two {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|3} options:

entries.name: Arcane Retaliation
entries: Your manipulation of the weave enables you to reflect incoming spells. When a creature that you can see casts a spell that targets only you or an allied creature within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction and expend one use of your {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|3} to make an Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) check contested by the creature's Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) check. If the result of your roll is higher than the opposing roll, the spell has no effect on you or your ally and instead targets the caster, using the slot level of the caster, but your weaveknight spell save DC, spell attack bonus and spellcasting ability.

entries.name: Esoteric Spellstrike
entries: When you use your {@classFeature Spellstrike|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|2} feature, you can expend one use of your {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|3} to cast any spell on the weaveknight spell list with it, provided it is eligible for {@classFeature Spellstrike|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|2}, even if you don't know the spell. You still expend a spell slot to cast the spell as normal.

subclassFeature.name: Calculating Mind
entries: You find ways to solve problems through the power of your mind. Whenever you make a Wisdom or Charisma ability check or saving throw, you can expend one use of your {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|3} to make an Intelligence ability check or saving throw instead.

subclassFeature.name: Favored by Magic
entries: Your dedication towards studying the arcane arts makes magic favor you. While you are concentrating on a spell, you gain the following benefits:

items: You can add your Intelligence modifier to the damage rolls of weapon attacks you make with {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1} you're wielding (with a minimum bonus of +1).
You gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed and can hover.
If your total for an Intelligence ability check or saving throw is less than your Intelligence score, you can use that score in place of the total.

subclassFeature.name: Grand Arcana Esoterica
entries: Your mastery over the arcane arts manifests fully. As an action, you can name a spell of your choice from the spell list of the class you chose with your {@subclassFeature Arcana Esoterica|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|Mystara|CoH-Weaveknight|3} feature that is 8th level or lower and has a casting time of 1 action, forcing the weave of magic to obey your will. You don't need to meet any requirements of the spell, including any costly components: the spell simply takes effect as part of this action.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Armsmeister
entries: As the various weaveknight disciplines spread, new styles emerge. Most innovative among them being that of Armsmeisters, expert warriors manifesting their magic into arcane weapons. Utilizing evocation and conjuration magic, they have attained an unparalleled mastery over warfare, reflected by their abilities to wield multiple armaments through sheer mental commands. Armsmeister weaveknights are pioneers of a new era, ready to cement their discipline as the superior school.

subclassFeature.name: Discipline Spells
entries: You learn discipline spells at the weaveknight levels listed in the Armsmeister Spells table. Discipline spells count as weaveknight spells for you, but they don't count against the number of weaveknight spells you know.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Arsenal
entries: When you summon an {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1||Arcane Armament} melee weapon, you can cause it to appear in any unoccupied space that you can see within 30 feet of you and become animated, floating in space. A creature that tries to wield one of your animated {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1} against your will must first succeed on a Strength check against your weaveknight spell save DC or it can't move the animated {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1||Arcane Armament} at all. Attacks you make with animated {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1} use your Intelligence modifier for the attack and damage rolls, and you can use your {@classFeature Spellstrike|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|2} feature with any animate {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1||Arcane Armament}, even if you aren't wielding it.

items: On your turn, you can mentally command any number of animated {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1} to move up to 30 feet in any direction (no action required). If an animated {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1||Arcane Armament} is ever more than 60 feet from you at the end of your turn, it is shunted back into the extradimensional space you summoned it from.
Any attack you make on your turn can originate from your space or an animated {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1||Arcane Armament}'s space.

When a creature that you can see within 5 feet of an animated {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1||Arcane Armament} moves at least 5 feet away from it, you can use your reaction to make an {@action opportunity attack} against that creature as if you were in the {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1||Arcane Armament's} space.

subclassFeature.name: Surge of the Armsmeister
entries: You gain the following two {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|3} options:

entries.name: Armament Warp
entries: As a bonus action, you can expend one use of your {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|3} to teleport, magically swapping places with an animated {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1||Arcane Armament} within 30 feet of you.

entries.name: Arsenal Assault
entries: As an action, you can expend one use of your {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|3} to make an attack with each of your animated {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1}.

subclassFeature.name: Armsmeister's Parry
entries: When a creature you can see hits a target within 5 feet of an animate {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1||Arcane Armament} with an attack, you can use your reaction and expend one use of your {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|3} to command that armament to defend against the attack. The damage the target takes from the attack is reduced by an amount equal to the damage dice of the animated {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1||Arcane Armament} + your Intelligence modifier + half your weaveknight level. After reducing the damage of an attack this way, the animated {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1||Arcane Armament} is shunted back to the extradimensional space you summoned it from.

subclassFeature.name: Empowered Arsenal
entries: The benefits of your {@subclassFeature Surge of the Armsmeister|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|Armsmeister|CoH-Weaveknight|3} feature improve, as detailed below:

entries.name: Armament Warp
entries: When you finish teleporting with this feature, all creatures in a 5-foot-wide line between the space you left and the space you appear in must make a Dexterity saving throw against your weaveknight spell save DC. On a failed save, a creature takes force damage equal to the damage dice of the animated {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1||Arcane Armament} you swapped places with + your Intelligence modifier.

entries.name: Arsenal Assault
entries: When you use this feature, you can use your {@classFeature Spellstrike|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|2} feature in place of one of the attacks you make with an animated {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1||Arcane Armament}, but you can only use your {@classFeature Spellstrike|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|2} feature with an animated {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1||Arcane Armament}.

subclassFeature.name: Summoner's Flourish
entries: As a bonus action, you can enhance all of your animated {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1} for 1 minute, gaining the following benefits for the duration:

items: You can use your {@subclassFeature Empowered Arsenal|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|Armsmeister|CoH-Weaveknight|15||Armament Warp and Arsenal Assault} features without expending uses of your {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|3}, but you can still produce only one effect that requires you to expend a use of your {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|3} per turn.

When you use your {@subclassFeature Empowered Arsenal|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|Armsmeister|CoH-Weaveknight|15||Arsenal Assault} feature and cast a spell with your {@classFeature Spellstrike|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|2} feature as part of the same action on your turn, any attacks you make with your animated {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1} deal extra force damage equal to twice the channelled spell's level on a hit until the end of that turn.

After you deal damage to a creature with an animated {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1||Arcane Armament} on a turn, you have advantage on the next weapon attack you make against that creature until the end of that turn.

entries: Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest, unless you expend a 5th-level spell slot to use it again.

subclassFeature.name: The Godsbane
entries: Though unmentioned in history, weaveknight tradition did not just begin with a quest for knowledge. Some of the first weaveknights viewed the influence of divinity as a cosmic limit placed on the true potential of mortals. Thus, they followed a lonely path, training relentlessly to become sentinels of the mortal realm, slaying gods and fiends alike whenever they attempted to meddle as was common in the old ages. They became legends, striking fear throughout the higher and lower planes alike, as the ones who put the term immortal to the test.

subclassFeature.name: Godsbane Magic
entries: You learn an additional spell when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the Godsbane Spells table. The spell counts as a weaveknight spell for you, but it doesn't count against the number of weaveknight spells you know.

subclassFeature.name: Unearthing Divinity
entries: You have studied the origins of divinity. You have advantage on ability checks that you make to recall or discern the lore, status and goals of aberrations, celestials, elementals, fey and fiends, as well as advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) checks you make against creatures of those types.

subclassFeature.name: Surge of the Godsbane
entries: You gain the following two {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|3} options:

entries.name: Arcane Chains
entries: As a bonus action, you can expend one use of your {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|3} and choose a creature that you can see within 30 feet of you, causing ethereal chains to encompass it. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw against your weaveknight spell save DC. On a failed save, the target becomes {@condition frightened} of you for 1 minute. While {@condition frightened} in this way, the target must subtract your Intelligence modifier from any saving throws it makes, except Wisdom saving throws. The target can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Mortal Defiance
entries: When a creature forces you to make a saving throw, you use your reaction and expend one use of your {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|3} to gain a bonus to the roll equal to your Inteligence modifier (minimum +1). If you succeed on the saving throw, the creature that forced you to make the saving throw takes psychic damage equal to half your weaveknight level + your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1).

subclassFeature.name: Mortal Sentinel
entries: You have become accustomed to the ways extraplanar beings fight and learnt how to prepare against them. You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.
In addition, when you finish a long rest, you gain resistance to one damage type of your choice except bludgeoning, piercing or slashing until the end of your next long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Unyielding Spirit
entries: You have molded your mind and body to become a weapon against the extraplanar. All creatures affected by your Arcane Chains lose any immunity they might have to the {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} condition.

In addition, when you succeed on a saving throw that benefitted from your Mortal Defiance, and a creature affected by your Arcane Chains forced you to make that saving throw, the damage it takes from Mortal Defiance is doubled.

subclassFeature.name: Godslayer
entries: You can channel the arcane energies and the wrath in your soul to transform yourself. As a bonus action, you gain the following benefits for 1 minute:

items: You have resistance to all damage, and immunity to the damage type you chose with your {@subclassFeature Mortal Sentinel|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|Godsbane|CoH-Weaveknight|7} feature.

You have advantage on weapon attacks against creatures affected by your Arcane Chains, and your weapon attacks with {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1} against them deal an extra {@damage 2d6} force damage on a hit.

When you take the {@action Attack} action, you can make an additional attack as part of that action against a creature affected by your Arcane Chains or that is {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} of you.

entries: Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest, unless you expend a 5th-level spell slot to use it again.

spell.name: Venomous Spellstrike
entries: Make a melee spell attack against a creature you can touch. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d6} poison damage and must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} until the spell ends.
A creature {@condition poisoned} by this spell makes another Constitutioon saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd-level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 4d6|1-9|1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Corrosive Spellstrike
entries: Make a melee spell attack against a creature you can touch. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d6} acid damage and must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or nonmagical armor worn by the target takes a non-cumulative penalty to the AC it offers equal to this spell's level until the spell ends.
A creature affected by this spell makes another Dexterity saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Ignited Spellstrike
entries: Make a melee spell attack against a creature you can touch. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d6} fire damage and catches on fire.

At the end of each of its turns until the spell ends, a creature that has caught on fire by this spell must make a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 1d6} fire damage. On a successful save, the spell ends. If the target or a creature within 5 feet of it uses an action to put out the flames, or if some other effect douses the flames (such as the target being submerged in water), the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the initial fire damage dealt by the spell increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Shocking Spellstrike
entries: Make a melee spell attack against a creature you can touch. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d6} lightning damage and must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become unable to take reactions until the spell ends.
A creature affected by this spell makes another Constitution throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Frigid Spellstrike
entries: Make a melee spell attack against a creature you can touch. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d6} cold damage and must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or have its speed become 0 until the spell ends.
A creature affected by this spell makes another Constitution throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Mindshattering Spellstrike
entries: Make a melee spell attack against a creature you can touch. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 4d6} psychic damage and must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of you until the spell ends.
A creature {@condition frightened} by this spell makes another Wisdom saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd-level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 4d6|2-9|1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Jade Spellstrike
entries: Make a melee spell attack against a creature you can touch. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 4d6} psychic damage and one creature of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you gains temporary hit points equal to half the amount of psychic damage dealt that last until the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Thundering Spellstrike
entries: Make a melee spell attack against a creature you can touch. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 4d6} thunder damage and must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away from you in a straight line. If a Large or smaller creature fails this saving throw, it is also knocked {@condition prone}.
This spell creates a loud noise audible up to 300 feet away.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Warmaster's Spellstrike
entries: Make a melee spell attack against a creature you can touch. On a hit, up to two creatures of your choice within 5 feet of the target can immediately use their reactions, if available, to make a melee weapon attack against it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can choose one additional creature with this spell for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Vampiric Spellstrike
entries: Make a melee spell attack against a creature you can touch. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 5d6} necrotic damage and you regain an amount of hit points equal to half the amount of necrotic damage dealt.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Radiant Spellstrike
entries: Make a melee spell attack against a creature you can touch. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 5d6} radiant damage and must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become {@condition blinded} until the spell ends.
A creature {@condition blinded} by this spell makes another Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Iron Spellstrike
entries: Make a melee spell attack against a creature you can touch. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 5d6} bludgeoning damage and must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become {@condition stunned} until the spell ends.
A creature {@condition stunned} by this spell makes another Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Disjuncting Spellstrike
entries: Make a melee spell attack against a creature you can touch. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 5d6} force damage and whenever it casts a spell while this spell lasts, it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or the spell it tries to cast fails and is lost.
A creature affected by this spell makes another Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Amber Spellstrike
entries: Make a melee spell attack against a creature you can touch. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 6d6} lightning damage and must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become {@condition restrained} until the spell ends.
A creature {@condition restrained} by this spell makes another Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Enervating Spellstrike
entries: Make a melee spell attack against a creature you can touch. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 6d6} cold damage and must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or suffer one level of {@condition exhaustion} per level of this spell until the spell ends. This spell can't bring a creature's level of {@condition exhaustion} above 5.
A creature affected by this spell makes another Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Mirage Spellstrike
entries: Make a melee spell attack against a creature you can touch. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 6d6} psychic damage and must succeed on an Intelligence saving throw or become {@condition incapacitated} until the spell ends.
A creature affected by this spell makes another Intelligence saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Ruby Spellstrike
entries: Make a melee spell attack against a creature you can touch. On a hit, the target and each creature of your choice within 20 feet of it must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 6d6} fire damage, or half as much on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Novaburst Spellstrike
entries: Make a melee spell attack against a creature you can touch. On a hit, the target and each creature of your choice within 10 feet of it must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 7d6} radiant damage, or half as much on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Astral Spellstrike
entries: Make a melee spell attack against a creature you can touch. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 7d6} psychic damage and must succeed on an Intelligence saving throw or have its mind overcome by psychic energy until the spell ends. While a creature's mind is overcome by psychic energy with this spell, that creature doesn't add its proficiency bonus to any attack rolls and ability checks it normally would.
A creature affected by this spell makes another Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Blade Mirage

m.text: a melee weapon you are proficient with worth at least 1 sp

entries: You touch the weapon used in the spell's casting and imbue it with illusory magic. When you cast the spell and as a bonus action on subsequent turns until the spell ends, you can cause illusory copies of the weapon to assault a creature of your choice you can see, forcing it to make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, you gain advantage on the next attack you make with the weapon against the target before the end of the current turn.

As an action, a creature that can see you can make an Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check against your spell save DC. If it succeeds, you can no longer gain advantage on attacks with the weapon against that creature with this spell for the duration.

Creatures that are {@condition blinded||blind}, don't rely on sight to perceive their surroundings, such as with {@sense blindsight}, or can see through illusions, such as with {@sense truesight}, are immune to the effects of this spell.

spell.name: Crackling Bolt
entries: Crackling blue energy is gathered at the tips of your hands. When you cast the spell, and as an action on subsequent turns for the duration, you can direct the energy towards a creature you can see within range. When you do so, make a ranged spell attack against the target. You have advantage on the attack roll if the target has taken lightning damage within the last round. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d12} lightning damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 3rd- or 4th- level spell slot, the damage increases to {@dice 2d12}. When you cast this spell using a 5th- or 6th-level spell slot, the damage increases to {@dice 3d12}. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases to {@dice 4d12}.

spell.name: Elemental Redirection

time.condition: which you take when you take acid, cold, fire, lightning or thunder damage

entries: You manipulate the elemental energy assaulting you, redirecting some of it. The damage you take from the triggering damage type is reduced by an amount equal to {@dice 2d10} + your spellcasting ability, and you can choose one creature you can see within 30 feet of you. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw. The target takes damage of the triggering damage type equal to the amount of damage you reduced with this spell on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage you reduce with this spell increases by {@dice 2d10} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Earthen Ward

time.condition: which you take when you are hit by an attack and are within 5 feet of the ground or a surface made of stone

entries: You cause the ground or stone within 5 feet of you to rise into the form of an earthen ward between you and the triggering attack. The ward appears in the form of a 5-by-5 foot panel that is 6 inches thick. It has an AC of 11 + your spellcasting ability modifier and 10 hit points. If the ward cuts through a creature's space when it appears, the creature is pushed to one side of the ward (your choice).
The ward takes the damage from the triggering attack instead of you. If the attack reduces the ward to 0 damage, the ward is destroyed, and you take any remaining damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the ward's AC increases by 1 and its hit points increase by 10 for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Glacial Breath
entries: Holding your open palm under your chin, you exhale a freezing cold wind from your mouth. Each creature in a 15-foot cone must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 2d8} cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Creatures that fail their saving throw also have their speed reduced by 10 feet until the end of their next turn.
The cold from your breath freezes all nonmagical liquids in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Scholarly Touch
entries: You touch one nonmagical object covered in writing, such as a book or a scroll, and absorb the knowledge contained within it as if you had just read it. The knowledge you acquire is equal to a thorough reading, but not deep study. Therefore, you do not recall all the information contained in the object perfectly, but can give a perfectly good summary of it, and remember important details that you were looking for or found interesting.

Casting this spell again on the same object does not convey any further information, but can refresh your memory on details specified when casting the spell. This spell has no effect if you touch an object covered in writing in a language that you can't read.

spell.name: Elemental Blast
entries: You gather elemental energy at your fingertips and hurl it at a creature of your choice you can see within range. Choose acid, cold, fire, lightning or poison for the type of energy you gather and then make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@dice 3d8} damage of the type you chose.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Warp Strike

m.text: a melee weapon you are proficient with worth at least 1 sp

entries: You brandish the weapon used in the spell's casting and then slash with it, warping space. Choose a creature you can see within 60 feet of you. Make a melee attack against the target with the weapon used in the spell's casting. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects and takes an additional {@damage 2d6} force damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6}, and the range increases by 10 feet for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Ice Blast
entries: The moisture in the air condenses into ice and then erupts in a freezing burst at a point you choose within range. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 3d8} cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
The ground in the area is covered with a thick layer of ice, and is considered difficult terrain until the start of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Lesser Fire Form
entries: Your form shifts, assuming the nature of elemental flames. For the duration, you gain the following benefits:

items: You shed bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet, and you have resistance to cold and fire damage.

Your movement is unaffected by difficult terrain, and you can move through the space of other creatures. The first time on your turn that you enter a creature's space, that creature takes {@damage 1d10} fire damage.

spell.name: Lesser Ice Form
entries: Your form shifts, assuming the nature of elemental ice. For the duration, you gain the following benefits:

items: You have resistance to cold and fire damage and you can move across difficult terrain created by ice or snow without spending extra movement.
The ground in a 10-foot radius around you is icy and is difficult terrain for creatures other than you. The radius moves with you.

spell.name: Lesser Stone Form
entries: Your form shifts, assuming the nature of elemental earth. For the duration, you gain the following benefits:

items: You have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks.
Your AC becomes equal to your spellcasting ability score, if it was lower.

spell.name: Lesser Water Form
entries: Your form shifts, assuming the nature of elemental water. For the duration, you gain the following benefits:

items: You have resistance to acid and fire damage.

Your movement is unaffected by difficult terrain and you can move through the space of other creatures. The first time on a turn that you move through the space of a creature no more than one size larger than you, that creature must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

spell.name: Lesser Wind Form
entries: Your form shifts, assuming the nature of elemental wind. For the duration, you gain the following benefits:

items: You have resistance to lightning and thunder damage.

Your movement is unaffected by difficult terrain and you can move through the space of other creatures. During your turn, you gain a flying speed equal to half your walking speed but can't hover. If you are still flying when your turn or the spell ends, you fall, unless you somehow prevent it.

spell.name: Mystic Blade Charge

m.text: a melee weapon you are proficient with worth at least 1 sp

entries: You brandish the weapon used in the spell's casting and transform into a torrent of ethereal arcane energy. Choose a creature you can see within range. You teleport to an unoccupied space of your choice you can see within 5 feet of the target.

When you finish teleporting, you can make a weapon attack with the weapon used in the spell's casting against the target. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects and takes an additional {@damage 2d6} force damage.

Additionally, immediately after you finish teleporting, the path in a 5-foot-wide line between the space you left and the space you appear in is ravaged by arcane energy. Any creature within 5 feet of the line, excluding you and the target, must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes force damage equal to the damage dice of the weapon plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the range of the spell increases by 30 feet, and the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Retaliating Counter

time.condition: which you take when a creature that you can see within the spell's range deals damage to you

m.text: a melee weapon you are proficient with worth at least 1 sp

entries: You brandish the weapon used in the spell's casting and vanish to perform a retaliating strike. You teleport to an unoccupied space you can see within 5 feet of the creature that dealt damage to you and can immediately make a weapon attack against it with the weapon used in the spell's casting.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the range of the spell increases by 30 feet for each slot level above 2nd, and on a hit, the weapon attack you make as part of casting this spell deals an extra {@damage 1d8} force damage for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Rolling Stone

m.text: a stone object of medium size you can see within the spell's range, which the spell consumes

entries: You imbue the object used in the spell's casting with magic and immediately cause it to travel in a straight line towards a point of your choice within range that is on the ground or a solid surface. When the object reaches the point you chose, it stops traveling, and the spell ends. The spell ends early if the object is destroyed while traveling or if it stops while traveling due to it being unable to move (such as by slamming into a wall of force spell).

While the object is traveling, any creature within 5 feet of its path must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 2d10} bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save, or half as much damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone} on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10}, and the range increases by 30 feet for each slot level above 2nd.
When you cast this spell using a 3rd- or 4th-level spell slot, the size of the object used in the spell's casting can be medium or large.
When you cast this spell using a 5th- or 6th-level spell slot, the size of the object used in the spell's casting can be medium, large, or huge.

spell.name: Whirlwind Slash

m.text: a melee weapon you are proficient with worth at least 1 sp

entries: You brandish the weapon used in the spell's casting and perform three powerful slashes in quick succession, sending a razor-sharp torrent of wind towards a creature of your choice you can see within range with each slash. You can direct all slashes towards the same target or towards different targets.
For each slash, make a melee weapon attack with the weapon used in the spell's casting. On a hit, the target of a slash suffers the attack's normal effects and is pushed 10 feet away from you.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can perform one additional slash for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Arcane Lance
entries: You condense raw magic in your hand and hurl it in the form of a lance at a creature you can see within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 6d6} force damage.

The lance travels in a straight 5-foot wide line between you and the target. Each creature excluding you and the target within 5 feet of the line as the lance travels must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 6d6} force damage on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Combustion
entries: A spontaneous explosion of flame manifests around a point you choose within range. Each creature in a 15-foot radius sphere centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 6d6} fire damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}. The explosion ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried and pushes them 30 feet away from the explosion's center if they are Large or smaller.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Dimensional Slash

m.text: a melee weapon you are proficient with worth at least 1 sp

entries: You brandish the weapon used in the spell's casting and unleash a slash, cutting through dimensions. Each creature in a 15-foot cone must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes force damage equal to the damage dice of the weapon used in the spell's casting plus an additional {@damage 4d6} force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
This spell also affects creatures in the ethereal plane.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Earthglide
entries: You touch a willing creature. For the duration, the target gains a burrowing speed of 30 feet and can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone. While doing so, the target doesn't disturb the material it moves through.
If the spell ends while the target is burrowing, the target is immediately shunted to the space it started burrowing from or the closest unoccupied space to it if it is occupied.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
