entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Entropic Touch
entries: Entropic energy engulfs your hand. Make a melee spell attack against a creature within your reach. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 5d8} necrotic damage and for the duration, the target must roll a {@dice d4} at the start of each of its turns to determine how the entropic energy affects it until the start of its next turn, as shown in the table below.

rows: The target has disadvantage on Strength, Dexterity and Constitution saving throws.
The target has disadvantage on all attack rolls and all damage it deals is halved.
The target's speed is halved, it can't make more than one attack during its turn, and it can't take reactions.
The target becomes {@condition blinded} and it can't speak.

entries: A target affected by the entropic energy can make a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, the entropic energy disappears and the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Ground Slam
entries: You slam or stomp on the ground, causing a powerful ripple in a 30-foot radius around you. Each creature in contact with the ground in the affected area other than you must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 3d10} bludgeoning damage, is moved 5 feet in a direction of your choice and knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save, or takes half as much damage and isn't moved or knocked {@condition prone} on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th-level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} and the radius of the affected area around you increases by 10 feet for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Ice Lance
entries: You conjure pure frost, forming it into an icy spear, which you hurl at a target within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 4d6} piercing damage and {@damage 4d6} cold damage.
In addition, a target that takes cold damage from this spell has its speed reduced to 0 and can't take reactions until the end of its next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, both the piercing and cold damage increase by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Magic Vestment
entries: You touch a suit of nonmagical armor or a nonmagical {@item shield|PHB}. Until the spell ends, the item you touched gains the following properties depending on its type:

entries.name: Suit of Armor
entries: The suit of armor becomes magical and any creature wearing it has a +1 bonus to AC.

entries.name: Shield
entries: The {@item shield|PHB} becomes magical and any creature holding it has a +1 bonus to AC, in addition to the shield's normal bonus to AC.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the bonus increases to +2. When you use a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the bonus increases to +3.

spell.name: Wraithstrike

m.text: a weapon you are proficient with worth at least 1 sp

entries: You touch and transmute the weapon used in the spell's casting. Until the spell ends, whenever you make a weapon attack using the weapon, if the target is wearing nonmagical armor or no armor at all (even if it has natural armor), you treat its AC as 10 + their Dexterity modifier.
Magical armor as well as magical effects that increase the target's AC can't be bypassed with this spell (such as the {@spell mage armor} and {@spell shield} spells).

spell.name: Arcane Blast
entries: You gather magical energy within yourself and unleash it in a powerful blast. All creatures within 20 feet of you must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 7d6} force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one, and every creature that fails the save is pushed 10 feet away from you and knocked {@condition prone}.
In addition, unsecured objects within the area of the blast take {@damage 7d6} force damage and are likewise pushed 10 feet away from you.

spell.name: Dimensional Anchor
entries: Green-tinted energy encircles your hand and streaks towards a creature of your choice within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target becomes unable to move or be moved using teleportation or by extradimensional or interplanar means until the spell ends. This also prevents the target from passing or being pulled through an interdimensional portal, such as the one made by {@spell teleportation circle}.

At the end of each of the target's turns, it can make a Charisma saving throw against the spell. On a success, the spell ends. If the target of the spell is a summoned creature, the summoned creature is not prevented from disappearing at the appropriate time, such as when the spell that summoned it ends.

spell.name: Emergency Transposition

time.condition: which you take when a creature that you can can see targets you with an attack

entries: You attempt to evade an incoming attack by teleporting yourself out of harm's way, swapping places with another creature, except the creature that targeted you with the triggering attack.

Choose a space within range that is occupied by a Small or Medium creature that you can see. If that creature is willing, you both teleport, swapping places, and the creature becomes the new target of the attack. If that creature is unwilling, it must make a Charisma saving throw. On a successful save, the spell fails and has no effect. On a failed save, you both teleport, swapping places, and the creature becomes the new target of the attack.

spell.name: Fissure
entries: You create a fissure, rending the earth in a 60-foot long, 10-foot wide and 10-foot deep line originating from you and heading towards a direction of your choice. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature falls into the fissure, taking {@damage 5d10} bludgeoning damage from the fall and being knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, a creature is pushed away from the fissure's edge in a direction vertical to the fissure, until it reaches a space 5 feet away from the fissure's edge.

The area affected by the fissure becomes difficult terrain as it is filled with rubble. Objects within the area affected by the fissure take {@damage 5d10} bludgeoning damage from this spell and may collapse completely or partially.

spell.name: Flash Freeze
entries: You evoke a wave of freezing cold energy around a point of your choice within range. Each creature in a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 5d8} cold damage and is {@condition restrained} until the start of your next turn on a failed save, or half as much damage and isn't {@condition restrained} on a successful one.

spell.name: Reaving Weapon
entries: You imbue a weapon you touch with reaving arcane power. Until the spell ends, the weapon becomes magical if it wasn't already, and the first time on a turn that a creature deals damage with an attack using the weapon, it can choose up to two creatures within 5 feet of the attack's target. Each of the chosen creatures must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take force damage equal to half of the attack's damage.

spell.name: Storm Shield
entries: A veil of wind and lightning engulfs your body for the duration. You can end the spell early by using an action to dismiss it.

The veil provides you with a charged shield or a booming shield, as you choose. Whenever a creature within 5 feet of you hits you with an attack, it takes {@damage 2d8} lightning damage and can't take reactions until the end of the current turn from a charged shield, or {@damage 2d8} thunder damage and is pushed 10 feet away from you from a booming shield.

spell.name: False Sending

components.m: A short piece of corroded copper wire

entries: You send a short message of twenty-five words or less to a creature with which you are familiar. When you do so, you may choose to impersonate another creature that both you and the recipient of the message are familiar with and try to make it appear so that the sender of the message was the impersonated creature.

The recipient of the message hears the message in its mind, and must make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, the recipient of the message is convinced that the sender is the impersonated creature. On a successful save, the recipient of the message understands the nature of the impersonation and knows that the impersonated creature and the sender are not the same person, but can't discern your real identity even if it knows you. The creature receiving the message can answer in a like manner immediately. The spell enables creatures with Intelligence scores of at least 1 to understand the meaning of your message.
You can send the message across any distance and even to other planes of existence, but if the target is on a different plane than you, there is a {@chance 5} chance that the message doesn't arrive.

spell.name: Lightning Blast
entries: A powerful blast of lightning is unleashed around a point you choose within range. Each creature in a 30-foot radius centered on that point must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature has disadvantage on the saving throw if it is wearing metal armor or if it is a creature made of metal. A creature takes {@damage 4d12} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that fails this saving throw can't take reactions until the start of its next turn.

spell.name: Pyroblast
entries: You create a 20-foot-radius sphere of condensed fire and hurl it towards a point of your choice that you can see within range. When the sphere reaches the point you chose, it explodes into roaring flames, and each creature within 60 feet of the point at which the sphere stopped must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 10d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The sphere travels in a straight line between you and the point you chose. Each creature caught in the sphere's path as it travels must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be dragged alongside the sphere.

spell.name: Vortex Strike

m.text: a melee weapon you are proficient with worth at least 1 sp

entries: You brandish the weapon used in the spell's casting and then vanish to strike through dimensions. Choose up to five creatures you can see within 30 feet of you. Make a melee attack against each target with the weapon used in the spell's casting. On a hit, a target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects and takes an additional {@damage 5d10} force damage.
You can then teleport to an unoccupied space you can see within 5 feet of one of the targets you hit or missed.

spell.name: Wondrous Projectiles

m.text: a ranged weapon with the ammunition property you are proficient with worth at least 1 sp

entries: You touch and transmute the weapon used in the spell's casting. Until the spell ends, the weapon ignores the loading property if it has it. If you load no ammunition in the weapon, it produces its own, automatically creating one piece of magic ammunition when you make a ranged attack with it, which deals an additional {@damage 2d6} force damage on a hit. The ammunition created by the weapon vanishes the instant after it hits or misses a target, or when the spell ends. If the weapon leaves your possession, the spell ends.

When you make a ranged attack with the weapon using a piece of magic ammunition created by the weapon, you can enchant the piece of ammunition as part of the attack, giving it one of the following effects:

entries.name: Disintegration
entries: A creature hit by the piece of ammunition takes an additional {@damage 4d6} force damage. If this damage reduces a creature to 0 hit points, the target is disintegrated.

entries.name: Displacement
entries: A creature hit by the piece of ammunition must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be teleported to an unoccupied space you can see within 30 feet of its location.

entries.name: Enthrallment
entries: A creature hit by the piece of ammunition must make a Wisdom saving throw, and it does so with advantage if you or your companions are fighting it. If it fails the saving throw, it is {@condition charmed} by you until the spell ends or until you or your companions do anything harmful to it. The {@condition charmed} creature is friendly to you. When the spell ends, the creature knows it was {@condition charmed} by you.

entries.name: Vacuum
entries: A creature hit by the piece of ammunition and all creatures within 30 feet of it must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, they take {@damage 4d6} thunder damage and are {@condition deafened} until the spell ends. On a successful save, they take half as much damage and are not {@condition deafened}. {@condition Deafened} creatures can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of their turns, ending the effect on themselves on a success.

optionalfeature.name: Coiling Viper Stance
entries: While maintaining this stance, the reach of your melee attacks increases by 5 feet and the range of your ranged attacks is doubled.
The Arcane Strike spell associated with this stance is the following one:

optionalfeature.name: Fluid Ooze Stance
entries: While maintaining this stance, you can't be {@condition restrained}.
The Arcane Strike spell associated with this stance is the following one:

optionalfeature.name: Rising Phoenix Stance
entries: While maintaining this stance, you gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed and can hover, as long as you are within 5 feet of a horizontal surface, such as the ground.
The Arcane Strike spell associated with this stance is the following one:

optionalfeature.name: Sky's Veins Stance
entries: While maintaining this stance, your speed increases by 10 feet.
The Arcane Strike spell associated with this stance is the following one:

optionalfeature.name: Winter Wolf Stance
entries: While maintaining this stance, you have advantage on the first melee attack roll that you make on your turn against a creature if at least one of your allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.
The Arcane Strike spell associated with this stance is the following one:

optionalfeature.name: Cleansed Mind Stance
entries: While maintaining this stance, you can't be {@condition charmed} andyou have advantage on Wisdom saving throws.
The Arcane Strike spell associated with this stance is the following one:

optionalfeature.name: Jade Lotus Stance
entries: While maintaining this stance, immediately after a creature misses you with an attack, you can move up to 5 feet without provoking {@action opportunity attack||opportunity attacks} (no action required). You can only do so once per turn.
The Arcane Strike spell associated with this stance is the following one:

optionalfeature.name: Roaring Lion Stance
entries: While maintaining this stance, you have advantage on Strength saving throws.
The Arcane Strike spell associated with this stance is the following one:

optionalfeature.name: Silver Raven Stance
entries: While maintaining this stance, creatures of your choice that start their turns within 5 feet of you have advantage on the first weapon attack they make on their turn.
The Arcane Strike spell associated with this stance is the following one:

optionalfeature.name: Crimson Moon Stance
entries: While maintaining this stance, magic can't put you to sleep and your hit point maximum cannot be reduced.
{@note Once you enter a 9th-level stance, you can't enter a 9th-level stance again until you finish a long rest, unless you expend a 3rd-level or higher spell slot to do so again.}
The Arcane Strike spell associated with this stance is the following one:

optionalfeature.name: Radiant Sun Stance
entries: While maintaining this stance, you and friendly creatures within 10 feet of you have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.
{@note Once you enter a 9th-level stance, you can't enter a 9th-level stance again until you finish a long rest, unless you expend a 3rd-level or higher spell slot to do so again.}
The Arcane Strike spell associated with this stance is the following one:

optionalfeature.name: Steel Warden Stance
entries: While maintaining this stance, hardened mana covers your body, reducing bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage you take from nonmagical attacks by an amount equal to 1 + your Intelligence modifier (minimum reduction of 1).
{@note Once you enter a 9th-level stance, you can't enter a 9th-level stance again until you finish a long rest, unless you expend a 3rd-level or higher spell slot to do so again.}
The Arcane Strike spell associated with this stance is the following one:

optionalfeature.name: War Sage Stance
entries: While maintaining this stance, you have advantage on Constitution saving throws that you make to maintain concentration on a spell.
{@note Once you enter a 9th-level stance, you can't enter a 9th-level stance again until you finish a long rest, unless you expend a 3rd-level or higher spell slot to do so again.}
The Arcane Strike spell associated with this stance is the following one:

optionalfeature.name: Amber Azalea Stance
entries: While maintaining this stance, electric sparks pulse around you. Creatures of your choice that start their turns within 5 feet of you take lightning damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Intelligence modifier.
{@note Once you enter a 13th-level stance, you can't enter a 13th-level stance again until you finish a long rest, unless you expend a 4th-level or higher spell slot to do so again.}
The Arcane Strike spell associated with this stance is the following one:

optionalfeature.name: Creeping Shadow Stance
entries: While maintaining this stance, you become incorporeal. You can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. If you end your turn inside an object, you are shunted to the nearest unoccupied space, and take {@damage 1d10} force damage.
{@note Once you enter a 13th-level stance, you can't enter a 13th-level stance again until you finish a long rest, unless you expend a 4th-level or higher spell slot to do so again.}
The Arcane Strike spell associated with this stance is the following one:

optionalfeature.name: Desert Wind Stance
entries: While maintaining this stance, attacks against you that rely on sight have disadvantage. If you take damage, you lose this benefit until the start of your next turn.
{@note Once you enter a 13th-level stance, you can't enter a 13th-level stance again until you finish a long rest, unless you expend a 4th-level or higher spell slot to do so again.}
The Arcane Strike spell associated with this stance is the following one:

optionalfeature.name: Ruby Rose Stance
entries: While maintaining this stance, a pulsing cloak of fire envelops you. Whenever a creature within 5 feet of you hits you with an attack, a thorn of flame bursts from the cloak and the attacker takes fire damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Intelligence modifier.
{@note Once you enter a 13th-level stance, you can't enter a 13th-level stance again until you finish a long rest, unless you expend a 4th-level or higher spell slot to do so again.}
The Arcane Strike spell associated with this stance is the following one:

optionalfeature.name: Collapsing Star Stance
entries: While maintaining this stance, the area in a 30-foot radius centered on you becomes consumed by immense gravitational pressure. Creatures of your choice that start their turns within the affected area have their speed reduced to 0 until the start of their next turn, and must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against your weaveknight spell save DC or be pulled 10 feet towards you.

Whenever you expend a spell slot while maintaining this stance, residues of the magical energy remain within the area of gravity, and you gain a number of nova charges equal to the slot's level. All nova charges you have vanish when the stance ends. At the start of each of your turns, and whenever you cast {@spell novaburst spellstrike|CoH-Weaveknight}, creatures other than you within 10 feet of you take radiant damage equal to the number of nova charges you have.
{@note Once you enter a 17th-level stance, you can't enter a 17th-level stance again until you finish a long rest, unless you expend a 5th-level or higher spell slot to do so again.}
The Arcane Strike spell associated with this stance is the following one:

optionalfeature.name: Psychic Storm Stance
entries: While maintaining this stance, strong psychic winds rise in a 15-foot radius area centered on you. Creatures of your choice that start their turns within the affected area must succeed on an Intelligence saving throw against your weaveknight spell save DC or become psychically distorted until the start of their next turn. A psychically distorted creature is unable to expend spell slots, can't concentrate on spells and must subtract your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1) from any attack roll or ability check it makes.
{@note Once you enter a 17th-level stance, you can't enter a 17th-level stance again until you finish a long rest, unless you expend a 5th-level or higher spell slot to do so again.}
The Arcane Strike spell associated with this stance is the following one:

optionalfeature.name: Spellblade Style
entries: You adopt a particular style of fighting as an arcane warrior. Choose one of the following options. You can't take a Spellblade Style option more than once, even if you later get to choose again.

items.name: Arcane Archery
entries: While maintaining a stance, you don't have disadvantage on ranged attacks due to being within 5 feet of a hostile creature who can see you and isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

items.name: Arcane Defense
entries: While maintaining a stance, immediately after you expend a spell slot to cast a spell with your {@classFeature Spellstrike|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|2} feature, you gain a bonus to AC equal to the slot's level. This bonus lasts until the start of your next turn, until you use your {@classFeature Spellstrike|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|2} feature again, until you stop maintaining a stance or until a creature hits or misses you with an attack.

items.name: Arcane Dueling
entries: While maintaining a stance, when you are wielding an {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1||Arcane Armament} weapon that you're holding in one hand and no other weapons, you can add your Intelligence modifier to one damage roll of a spell you cast with your {@classFeature Spellstrike|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|2} feature.

items.name: Arcane Warmongering
entries: While maintaining a stance, when you roll a 1 or 2 on a damage die for the damage of a spell you cast with your {@classFeature Spellstrike|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|2} feature, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1 or a 2. You only gain this benefit when you hit a creature with a weapon attack using a weapon that has the two-handed or versatile property and use your {@classFeature Spellstrike|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|2} feature.

optionalfeature.name: Arcane Disciple
entries: You learn one spell of your choice from the weaveknight spell list. The spell must be of a level for which you have spell slots and it counts as a weaveknight spell for you, but it doesn't count against the number of weaveknight spells you know.
When you gain a level in this class, you can change the spell you chose with this secret art, but the new spell you choose must still be of a level for which you have spell slots.

optionalfeature.name: Battlemage's Shield
entries: When you cast the {@spell shield} spell, you also gain resistance to one of the damage types of the triggering attack (your choice) until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Enhance Armament
entries: When you finish a long rest, you can imbue an {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1||Arcane Armament} weapon, suit of armor or shield with magical power until you die or use this secret art again. For the duration, the imbued armament gains the following benefits depending on its type:

items.name: Weapon
entries: The armament becomes a magic weapon and gains a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls while you're wielding it, unless it is a magic weapon that already has a bonus to those rolls.

items.name: Suit of armor or shield
entries: The armament becomes magical and grants you a +1 bonus to AC while you're donning it, unless it is a magic suit of armor or shield that already grants you a bonus to AC.

optionalfeature.name: Expanded Armory
entries: You can also turn potions, scrolls and wondrous items into {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1}. You can have a number of potions, scrolls and wondrous items up to your Intelligence modifier turned into {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1} without those items counting against your maximum for your {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1}.

optionalfeature.name: Loremaster
entries: You can cast the {@spell identify} spell at will, without expending a spell slot, but you must choose a weapon, suit of armor or shield that you are proficient with as the target when you do so. In addition to any magical properties, you learn the target's original creator, its intended purpose and the name of the last person to wield it.

optionalfeature.name: Manaforging
entries: When you roll initiative or as a bonus action, you can condense mana around you to to create a Tiny or Small object out of pure magic. This can include any simple or martial weapon you are proficient with, provided that the weapon you create is appropriately sized for Medium or smaller creatures. Objects you create with this Secret Art can be dismissed at any time (no action required).

A weapon you create with this Secret Art counts as magical for the purposes of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage, and attacks you make with it count as attacks you make with an {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1||Arcane Armament} weapon. If you load no ammunition in a ranged weapon you create with this Secret Art, it produces its own, automatically creating one piece of magic ammunition when you make a ranged attack with it.

Objects you make this way have an AC equal to your Intelligence score and hit points equal to twice your weaveknight level. You can have a number of objects created with this Secret Art up to half your weaveknight level. If you create a new object with this Secret Art while at your maximum, the oldest object you made with this Secret Art dissipates.

optionalfeature.name: Practiced Arcane Strikes
entries: You've become incredibly accustomed to the hand motions required to perform certain spells. Arcane Strike spells you cast with your {@classFeature Spellstrike|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|2} feature don't require any spell components.

optionalfeature.name: Runic Armor
entries: You've learned a potent runic enchantment. You can perform a 10 minute ritual with an {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1||Arcane Armament} suit of armor, which can be done during a short rest. At the end of the ritual, you mark the suit of armor with the rune. While the marked armor has the benefits of your {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1} feature or until you perform this ritual and mark another suit of armor, you can use your Intelligence modifier, instead of Dexterity modifier, to determine your AC while wearing it.

optionalfeature.name: Skilled Practitioner
entries: You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice from the weaveknight class skill list.

optionalfeature.name: Spellblast
entries: When you take the {@action Attack} action while maintaining a stance, you can make a special attack with a free hand in place of any of your attacks.

This special attack is called a spellblast, and it can be either a ranged spell attack with a range of 120 feet, or a melee spell attack with a range of touch (your choice each time you make the attack). A spellblast attack uses your weaveknight spell attack bonus and targets one creature or object of your choice that you can see within its range.

On a hit, a spellblast deals damage equal to {@dice 1d8} + your Intelligence modifier. The type of the attack's damage is the type of damage dealt by the Arcane Strike spell associated with the stance you're maintaining, or force if the associated spell doesn't deal damage.

optionalfeature.name: Spell Flux
entries: While concentrating on a weaveknight spell that you've cast by expending a spell slot, your Strength score becomes equal to your Intelligence score, if it was lower.

optionalfeature.name: Additional Enhancements
entries: You can imbue up to two different {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1} with magical power when you use your Enhanced Armaments secret art.

optionalfeature.name: Arcane Push
entries: As a bonus action, you expend one use of your {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|3} to force all creatures within 10 feet of you to make a Strength saving throw against your weaveknight spell save DC. On a failed save, a creature is pushed 10 feet away from you. Objects within 10 feet of you that are not being worn, carried or secured in place, are pushed the same distance away from you in a straight line automatically. The range you push creatures away from you increases when you reach certain levels in this class: at 11th level (15 feet), and at 17th level (20 feet).

optionalfeature.name: Binding Chains
entries: As a bonus action or in place of one of your attacks when you take the {@action Attack} action, you can target a creature within 30 feet of you that is affected by your {@subclassFeature Surge of the Godsbane|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|Godsbane|CoH-Weaveknight|3||Arcane Chains} feature.
The target is pulled up to 10 feet closer to you, and takes psychic damage equal to your Intelligence modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Consuming Brand
entries: When a creature you've marked with your Magehunter's Brand feature dies and you aren't incapacitated, you can either gain temporary hit points equal to your weaveknight level + your Intelligence modifier or immediately apply the mark to a different creature you can see within 30 feet of you.

optionalfeature.name: Dedicated Scholar
entries: You learn how to create scrolls imbued with magic. You can transcribe any weaveknight spell that you know into a scroll, by expending a spell slot with a level equal to the spell's level, as well as 2 hours and 50 gp for each level of the spell, in addition to any material components the spell already has.

Once you have created a scroll with this Secret Art, it retains its magical potency for a number of days equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1). After this time has passed, the scroll loses its potency and becomes non-magical as the spell is lost.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Enhancement: Cold
entries: As a bonus action, you can expend one use of your {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|3} feature to enhance an {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1||Arcane Armament} that's benefiting from your Improved Armaments secret art. For the next minute, until you become {@condition incapacitated} or until you enhance it with a Secret Art that has the Enhance Armament Secret Art as a prerequisite again, the armament gains the following benefits depending on its type:

items.name: Weapon
entries: While you're wielding it, the armament deals cold damage instead of its normal damage type.

items.name: Suit of armor or shield
entries: The armament radiates freezing energy. Any creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of you has its speed reduced by 10 feet until the start of its next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Enhancement: Lightning
entries: As a bonus action, you can expend one use of your {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|3} feature to enhance an {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1||Arcane Armament} that's benefiting from your Improved Armaments secret art. For the next minute, until you become {@condition incapacitated} or until you enhance it with a Secret Art that has the Enhance Armament Secret Art as a prerequisite again, the armament gains the following benefits depending on its type:

items.name: Weapon
entries: While you're wielding it, the armament deals lightning damage instead of its normal damage type.

items.name: Suit of armor or shield
entries: The armament crackles with lightning. Any creature that hits you with an attack while within 5 feet of you is pushed 5 feet away from you if it is equal to your size or smaller.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Enhancement: Fire
entries: As a bonus action, you can expend one use of your {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|3} feature to enhance an {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1||Arcane Armament} that's benefiting from your Improved Armaments secret art. For the next minute, until you become {@condition incapacitated} or until you enhance it with a Secret Art that has the Enhance Armament Secret Art as a prerequisite again, the armament gains the following benefits depending on its type:

items.name: Weapon
entries: While you're wielding it, the armament deals fire damage instead of its normal damage type.

items.name: Suit of armor or shield
entries: The armament radiates intense heat. Any creature that hits you with an attack while within 5 feet of you takes fire damage equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1).

optionalfeature.name: Improved Defense
entries: Immediately after you expend a use of your {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|3}, the damage reduction of your {@subclassFeature Abjurant Defense|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|Spellwarden|CoH-Weaveknight|3} feature is doubled and applies to bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage from magical attacks as well. This benefit lasts until the start of your next turn, or until you expend a use of your {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|3} again.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Warp Step
entries: Immediately after you use your {@subclassFeature Surge of the Magus|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|Magus|CoH-Weaveknight|3||Warp Step} feature, your speed increases by 10 feet until the end of the current turn and your movement is unaffected by nonmagical difficult terrain.

optionalfeature.name: Shared Knowledge
entries: Choose one {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|3} effect available to a Weaveknight's Discipline other than your own at 3rd-level.
You add that effect to the list of effects you can produce with your {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|3} feature.

optionalfeature.name: Dimension Warp
entries: When you use your {@subclassFeature Empowered Arsenal|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|Armsmeister|CoH-Weaveknight|15||Armament Warp} feature, you can swap places with any creature that you can see within 5 feet of an animated {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1||Arcane Armament} instead of that armament, provided that creature is willing and within 30 feet of you.

optionalfeature.name: Empowered Shot
entries: When you hit a creature with an attack that benefits from your {@subclassFeature Piercing Shots|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|Spellbow|CoH-Weaveknight|15||Piercing Spellshot} feature, the target has disadvantage on the first saving throw it makes to resist the effects of the next weaveknight spell you cast before the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Fervorous Brand
entries: Immediately after you use your {@subclassFeature Spellcarving Brand|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|Magehunter|CoH-Weaveknight|7} feature on a creature, you gain advantage on the next weapon attack you make against that creature before the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Innovated Stance

otherSummary.entry: {@filter Stance without a level prerequisite|optionalfeatures|source=|feature type=Stance|level=!weaveknight level 5;!weaveknight level 9;!weaveknight level 13;!weaveknight level 17}

entries: You've started innovating new ways of fighting. When you finish a long rest, you can choose two stances you know, one of which must not have a level prerequisite. You then create an innovated stance, by making the following choices:

items: Choose one of the two stances to become the form. The form determines the benefits you gain while maintaining the innovated stance (they are the same benefits as the form's). These benefits do not include the form's associated Arcane Strike spell.

The stance that you didn't choose as a form, becomes the strike. The strike determines the innovated stance's associated Arcane Strike spell (it is the same associated Arcane Strike spell as the strike's).

entries: The innovated stance doesn't count against the number of stances you know. You can enter the innovated stance as described in your {@classFeature Arcane Warcraft|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1} feature, and you know the innovated stance until you use this Secret Art to create an innovated stance again.

optionalfeature.name: Knowledge of the Scholar
entries: You learn how to extract knowledge out of every strike. When you deal damage to a creature with a weaveknight spell, you immediately learn one of the following (your choice):

items: The creature's bonus to one saving throw of your choice.
All of the creature's damage resistances.
All of the creature's damage immunities.
All of the creature's condition immunities.

optionalfeature.name: Reflective Defense
entries: Whenever a creature within 5 feet of you hits you with an attack, and you reduce the attack's damage to 0 or cause it to miss with a weaveknight class feature or weaveknight spell you cast, you reflect some of the energy. The attacker takes force damage equal to the damage reduction of your Abjurant Defense.

optionalfeature.name: Relentless Chains
entries: As a bonus action, you can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see within 5 feet of a target affected by your Arcane Chains. To teleport in this way, you must be able to see the affected target.

optionalfeature.name: Runic Shield
entries: As a bonus action, you can expend one use of your {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|3} to cause an {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1||Arcane Armament} shield to animate and hover around your space, protecting you as if you were wielding it.

This effect lasts for 1 minute, until you use a bonus action to end the effect, until you equip a shield or until you die or become {@condition incapacitated}, at which point the shield falls to the ground or into your hand if you have one free.

optionalfeature.name: Sculpted Spellstrike
entries: When you cast a spell with your {@classFeature Spellstrike|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|2} feature, and that spell affects you or other creatures that you can see, you can choose a number of them equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum 1). The chosen creatures automatically succeed on their saving throws against the spell, and they take no damage if they would normally take half damage on a successful save.

optionalfeature.name: Surging Power
entries: Immediately after you expend a use of your {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|3} feature, any dice you roll for the damage of a spell you cast with your {@classFeature Spellstrike|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|2} feature increase by one step until the start of your next turn (for example, {@dice d6|d6s} become {@dice d8|d8s}).

optionalfeature.name: Transmute Armament: Speed
entries: As a bonus action, you can expend one use of your {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|3} feature to enhance an {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1||Arcane Armament} weapon that's benefiting from your Enhance Armament secret art.

For the next minute, until you become {@condition incapacitated} or until you enhance it with a Secret Art that has the Enhance Armament Secret Art as a prerequisite again, whenever you take the attack action, and attack only with the transmuted weapon, you can make a single additional attack with it as part of that action. You can do so only once during each of your turns, even if you take the {@action Attack} action more than once during a turn.

optionalfeature.name: Warding Armament

otherSummary.entry: an {@filter Elemental Enhancement Secret Art|optionalfeatures|feature type=Secret Art|level=weaveknight level 5|search=elemental}

entries: While you're donning an {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1||Arcane Armament} suit of armor or shield that you've enhanced with an Elemental Enhancement Secret Art, you have resistance to that Elemental Enhancement Secret Art's damage type.

optionalfeature.name: Absorb Knowledge
entries: When you successfully use your {@subclassFeature Surge of the Arcana Mystara Initiate|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|Mystara|CoH-Weaveknight|3||Arcane Retaliation} feature against a spell for which you have spell slots, you seize knowledge of its inner workings. You learn that spell and it counts as weaveknight spell for you but it doesn't count against the number of weaveknight spells you know. You know that spell until you finish a long rest or you use this Secret Art again, at which point the knowledge of its inner workings is released from your mind.

optionalfeature.name: Anathema
entries: Once per turn, when you hit a creature affected by your Arcane Chains with an attack using an {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1||Arcane Armament}, you can activate one of the following effects:

items: Gain temporary hit points equal to half the target's challenge rating, which last until the start of your next turn.
Cause the target to lose all of its damage resistances untilthe start of your next turn.

Cause the target to lose one use of its Legendary Actions or expend one use of your {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|3} to cause the target to become unable to use its Legendary Resistance until the start of your next turn (your choice).

optionalfeature.name: Arcane Charge
entries: Once per turn, immediately after you finish teleporting with a weaveknight class feature or weaveknight spell you cast, you can make one melee weapon attack against a creature you can reach (no action required).

optionalfeature.name: Arcane Shroud
entries: When you enter a stance with a level prerequisite of 13th-level or lower, you can expend one use of your {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|3} to create a shroud of arcane power within 10 feet of you. The shroud lasts until you stop maintaining the stance, or until you dismiss it (no action required). Creatures of your choice within the shroud gain the benefits of the stance you're maintaining.

optionalfeature.name: Armament Resonance
entries: When you cast a weaveknight spell or use a weaveknight class feature that affects one of your {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1||Arcane Armament} weapons, such as the {@spell magic weapon} spell or a Secret Art, you can cause all of your animated {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1} to also be affected by that weaveknight spell or class feature (at no additional cost). Once you use this Secret Art, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Overwhelming Spellstrike
entries: The damage of Arcane Strike spells you cast with your {@classFeature Spellstrike|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|2} feature ignores any resistances to its damage type that a creature affected by it has.

optionalfeature.name: Persist Enhancement

otherSummary.entry: {@filter Elemental Enhancement|optionalfeatures|feature type=Secret Art|level=weaveknight level 5|search=elemental} or a {@filter Transmute Armament Secret Art|optionalfeatures|feature type=Secret Art|level=weaveknight level 5;weaveknight level 9|search=transmute}
otherSummary.entrySummary: Elemental Enhancement or Transmute Armament Secret Art

entries: When you enhance an {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1||Arcane Armament} with an Elemental Enhancement or Transmute Armament Secret Art, you can expend a spell slot to change the enhancement's duration to a number of hours equal to the spell slot's level.

optionalfeature.name: Phalanx
entries: When you use your {@subclassFeature Piercing Shots|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|Spellbow|CoH-Weaveknight|15||Piercing Spellshot} feature, you can choose a creature other than yourself that you can see within 10 feet of you. The next time the chosen creature makes a ranged attack before the start of your next turn, it can apply the same effect to its attack.

optionalfeature.name: Relentless Pursuit
entries: When a creature marked by your Magehunter's Brand feature within 5 feet of you casts a spell or forces you to make a saving throw, you can use your reaction to make a melee weapon attack against that creature.

optionalfeature.name: Split Defense
entries: When you target a creature with an abjuration weaveknight spell you cast or affect it with your {@subclassFeature Aegis|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|Spellwarden|CoH-Weaveknight|7} feature, you can grant that creature the damage reduction of your {@subclassFeature Abjurant Defense|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|Spellwarden|CoH-Weaveknight|3} feature until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Versatile Spellcaster
entries: Your grasp over magic allows you to manipulate the arcane energies to your will depending on your needs. When you cast a weaveknight spell by expending a spell slot, you can expend two spell slots to cast it, instead of one. The combined level of the expended spell slots must be equal to or higher than the spell's lowest level. When you cast a spell this way, the spell is cast at a level equal to the combined level of the slots you expended, up to a level equal to the highest level weaveknight spell you can cast.
For example, you can expend two 1st-level spell slots to cast the 2nd-level spell {@spell hold person} with this Secret Art.

optionalfeature.name: Battlemage's Arcanum
entries: You learn one 6th-level spell of your choice from the wizard's spell list that is eligible to be cast with your {@classFeature Spellstrike|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|2} feature. It counts as a weaveknight spell for you, but it doesn't count against the number of spells you know.
You can cast that spell once without expending a spell slot or material components, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Spellbreaker
entries: Whenever you hit a creation of magical force produced by a spell, such as a {@spell wall of force}, with an attack using an {@classFeature Arcane Armaments|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|1||Arcane Armament} weapon, you can expend one use of your {@classFeature Arcane Surge|Weaveknight|CoH-Weaveknight|3} to attempt to break it. If the object of magical force doesn't have an AC normally, you treat its AC as equal to the spell save DC of the spell's caster. On a hit, you disintegrate the creation of magical force if it is Large or smaller (as per the {@spell disintegrate} spell). If the creation of magical force is Huge or larger, succeeding on your attack roll disintegrates a 10-foot-cube portion of it.

_.special: A letter of recommendation to a magic academy
A book from an ancestor of yours containing martial and meditative techniques

items.name: Skill Proficiencies:
items.entry: {@skill Arcana}, plus one from among {@skill Acrobatics,}, {@skill Athletics} and {@skill Investigation}.

items.name: Tool Proficiencies:
items.entry: One type of {@filter artisan's tools or one gaming set|items|type=artisan's tools;gaming set} of your choice

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: A set of {@item traveler's clothes|PHB}, a letter of recommendation to a magical academy, a book from an ancestor of yours containing martial and meditative techniques, and a {@item pouch|PHB} containing 10 gp

entries.name: Feature: Sword and Sorcery
entries: You have associated yourself with both practitioners of the arcane and hard trained warriors. Always keeping an ear on the ground, you have a knack for blending in with these kinds of people. As a result, you always pick up rumors about magical shops and auctions of rare antiquities, as well as offers of mercenary work.

rows: I have a lot of acquaintances, not a lot of friends.
I smile in the face of the impossible.
I try to be discreet, but I can't help jumping into action.
I lose myself in the realm of possibilities.
I feel most comfortable in the company of books and blades.
I starve for knowledge and new experiences.
I suffer in the presence of ignorance.
I'm an open book, but people are illiterate.
{@b Community.} Knowledge is a gift to be shared. (Good)
{@b Balance.} The true wonders of the world lie within its principles. (Lawful)
{@b Freedom.} The freedom to travel is the freedom to learn. (Chaotic)
{@b Greed.} Power is a privilege of the strong. (Evil)
{@b Knowledge.} True knowledge is my conviction. (Neutral)
{@b Responsibility.} A life full of challenges is a life well lived.(Any)
My life's purpose is to perfect my art.
I always go out of my way to help those who earned my respect.
Someone saw potential in me. To this day, I never refuse their guidance.
I respect warriors of all kinds.
I always see things through to the end.
My curiosity often puts me in dire situations.
I tend to misjudge my opponents.
I am willing to search anywhere for the right answers.
In my travels, I've encountered things that still haunt me.
I always try to correct mistakes, even if they're not my own.
I push people away to stay focused on my goals.

entries: Duality has always been in your nature. While aspiring youth gathered around trainers of sword or sages of magic, you found yourself in awe of not only one such path. Instead, mediating both, you dedicated twice the effort to carve a path of your own. Blending the wonders of magic and the might of the body, you strive to perfect this mixing art, to a tool of superiority. Always curious about the world, you strike out to meet new people, discover sights and obtain wisdom through experience. Knowledge from great adventures may perhaps lead you to a figure of lineage, who can unlock your true mighty potential.

{@note Note: this background is actually found in {@i The Weaveknight} v3.5, but it was {@link intended|https://www.reddit.com/r/UnearthedArcana/comments/16ue2t0/comment/k2ow5my/} to be included here.}

entries.name: Weaveknight
entries: Surrounded by undead profanities, an elven woman clad inmithral armor that reflects the crimson flames that frame the walls of the unholy sanctum readies her mighty blade, eyeing the evil necromancer about to complete the ritual. As the creatures charge her, she vanishes in a flash of blue light and reappears above the mage, weapon bathed in arcane energy, felling her foe with a mighty warcry.

A dragonborn dressed in silver and blue robes waves his torch, shedding light in the ancient texts carved upon the ruin's walls. As he begins to decrypt the message, the growling of two large beasts emerging from the shadows draws his attention. Smiling, the scholar draws his longsword and assumes a martial stance, sword held high above his head and crackling with lighting.

A human carefuly streches the string of her bow, waiting for her allies to give her an opening against the demon. As soon as she sees it, she releases the arrow, muttering incantations and imbuing it with power. As the arrow travels, it is engulfed in a brilliant light, and the demon roars loudly before it explodes in a blast of radiance.

Despite their unique styles, all weaveknights expertly weave powerful spells and strikes alike in a deadly combination. Whether lone warriors defending the realms, teachers and scholars, or adventurers seeking new wonders, weaveknights are united by the dedication in their art and their pursuit of excellence.

entries.name: Magic and Steel
entries: Born through the perfection of mixing warfare and arcane knowledge, weaveknights seek to master the esoteric art they have dedicated grand portions of their life to.

Unlike sorcerers or wizards, who approach arcane magic as panacea in all their endeavors, weaveknights view it as avaluable tool in their greater arsenal. Being versatile in their training, they achieve supremacy in both combat of magic and weaponry.

Weaveknights of sufficient skill have determined and cultivated a portfolio of skills appropriate to their taste, as such not only is it near impossible to mimic but also rendered moot to do so, by any other.

entries.name: Knowledge is Power
entries: A weaveknight understands the beauty hidden in unearthed secrets of a world filled with magic and wonder, as well as the malicious ways in which such powers can be wielded. Weaving spells and using secret esoteric techniques varying amongst each of their orders, all weaveknights are students of both war and magic, creating unique fighting styles and honing their skills in the pursuit of greater knowledge.

Discipline is a core characteristic of a weaveknight, forged into their hearts during years of intense training, but kindness and empathy are also encouraged for they are the only way these magical knights can remember the worth of caring for others and stay true to their cause.
Regardless of their differences, weaveknights defend the innocent from rogue spellcasters and magical threats, bound by a sense of duty towards society.

While many weaveknights live a life of solitude and dedicated study, striving to uncover ancient relics and texts, there are those that seek to connect with and teach others as they consider true knowledge a giftto be shared with the world.

entries.name: Creating an Weaveknight
entries: A weaveknight's life is almost synonymous with adventure. There is always some piece of lore or knowledge long forgotten in the world, waiting to be unveiled by a weaveknight.

Furthermore, a weaveknight's character background should incorporate the reasons they decided to pursue the art, as well as their various personal goals that drove them to endure the harsh training. How did you first realize your potential for the arcane arts? Were you a soldier with untapped magical potential, discovered by another weaveknight? Perhaps one of your ancestors was a member of a weaveknight order and you found their bonded weapon and books.

What weaveknight order did you train under and what relationships did you form? Were you groomed to be in the frontlines against abusers of magic, to become a teacher yourself and enlighten the future generations, or perhaps to undergo secret missions to recover lost artifacts? What secret arts and techniques did you decide to dedicate yourself to, as you polished your own unique way of fighting?

entries.name: Quick Build
entries: You can make a weaveknight quickly by following these suggestions. First, your highest ability score should be Strength or Dexterity, depending on your combat style and tactics. Your next highest ability score should be Intelligence, as it determines the power of your spellcasting and various magical abilities. Second, choose the {@background sage} or {@background spellsword initiate|CoH-Weaveknight} background.
